{"id":528134576,"lang":"cpp","time":"8 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1627228751,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/528134576/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Non-negative Integers without Consecutive Ones","memory":"6.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    \n    \n    \n    int findIntegers(int n) {\n        /*\n            dp[i][0]: ending with 0 and bounded\n            dp[i][1]: ending with 1 and bounded\n            dp[i][2]: ending with 0 and unbounded\n            dp[i][3]: ending with 1 and unbounded\n        */    \n        string bin;\n        while(n) {\n            bin.push_back(((n&1) + '0'));\n            n >>= 1;\n        }\n        reverse(bin.begin(), bin.end());\n        n = bin.length();\n        vector<array<int,4>> dp(n+1, {1, 0, 0, 0});\n        for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) {\n            int c = bin[i-1] - '0';\n            if (c == 0) {\n                dp[i][0] = dp[i-1][0] + dp[i-1][1];\n                dp[i][1] = 0;\n                \n                dp[i][2] = dp[i-1][2] + dp[i-1][3];\n                dp[i][3] = dp[i-1][2];\n            } else {\n                dp[i][0] = 0;\n                dp[i][1] = dp[i-1][0];\n                \n                dp[i][2] = dp[i-1][2] + dp[i-1][3] + dp[i-1][0] + dp[i-1][1];\n                dp[i][3] = dp[i-1][2];\n            }\n        }\n        return dp[n][0] + dp[n][1] + dp[n][2] + dp[n][3];\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"non-negative-integers-without-consecutive-ones"}
